summary: The concept "Republic of Burundi" is categorized under extra-European organisations and is redirected to the preferred term "Burundi." In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, Burundi's position is defined within the Common Foreign and Security Policy (CFSP). The implementation of decisions regarding Burundi is based on treaties established by the European Union. Notably, the Council of the European Union has made decisions concerning Burundi in March and June, reflecting the Union's commitment to engage with this nation. These actions are integral to the EU's broader strategy in fostering international relations and promoting stability in the region.
